turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: Hi, I have an offer you would not want to refuse.

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: What might this offer be?

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: Are you a fair person?

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: I try my best to be fair.

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: Have you ever stopped to think about the true meaning of life, liberty and the pursuit of happiness? I meant to really think about what those words mean to you?

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: To me, life, liberty, and happiness means doing what is right and being grateful for what I have, no matter how little it is.

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: That is a noteworthy and insightful answer. Yet for some how little the have is not enough to eat. The most basic of human necessities can not be met because they are so impoverished. That is not very fair in this world of plenty, is it?

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: There is enough in this world so that everyone's basic needs should be met. Greedy people make sure that doesn't happen, just so their banks accounts have more and more.

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: Yes, exactly right! So here is the offer to you, it is entirely your decision as to whether you wish to accept because you feel it is the right thing to do. What If I told you that you can help a child direly in need of the most basic need for survival for as little as 1 cent, and for up to two dollars you can help deliver what we so vigorously live by, a life of liberty and a pursuit of happiness. To this offer what would your response be?

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: I would donate $1.00, because every child should have enough to eat.

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: Your are the light of hope that stays in ones eyes through the darkest of times. I can not thank you enough for your generosity. The research team will collect all donations and send it to Save the Children. Thank you again.

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: Save the Children is a worthy cause. They do a lot for children.

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: That is great that you know of the cause. Since you are familiar and support it, how would you feel about increasing your donation to two dollars to really brighten someone's day?

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: I'm facing a month where money is going to be short and I have 3 grandsons to feed. We pretty much are living on a poverty level income with no help from social services.

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: I'm sorry to hear that. But something to consider is that as an American Citizen you are entitled to a wide range of social services as that you might not be aware of. I would highly suggest to look into the details of every available option in your state.  Remember that is we who are the people that _ We the people

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: The problem is that they want proof of everything, and I am getting social security for the kids from my sister, who is the legal guardian. She merely sends me the money, and there isn't any way for me to show proof of what is sent.

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: Most unfortunate indeed. I am however tying to secure the well being of many many more children right now and that means my time needs to be wisely allowed. So can I make an agreement now that you will donate one dollar to Save the Children?

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: Yes, I will definitely donate $1.

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: You are most generous, and even in hour time of need you still consider others. Myself and the Children thank you.

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: We have to share what we have, because everything that we have is a gift from God.

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: Indeed and thank you again.

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: Have a nice day!
